# Draft:Scott (Scottie) Ward__disambig_1

Scott "Scottie" Ward is an American media executive, television producer, actor, and private lending industry leader. He is the CEO of Think Realty, a national real estate investment media and education company owned by Ward Partners. Ward is known for co-creating the Discovery Networks television series Shipwreck Men, appearing in Hitchhiker Chronicles on FX, and for his leadership within the American Association of Private Lenders (AAPL), where he serves on the Board of Education and hosts the AAPL Fund Forum.
Early life and education
Scott Ward was born in Lansing, Michigan, United States.
Details about his early education and academic background have not been publicly disclosed.
Television and media career
Ward began his television career as an actor and producer, appearing in two seasons of the FX reality television series Hitchhiker Chronicles.
He later co-created and produced Shipwreck Men, a reality series produced under Discovery Networks / Discovery Studios, which followed marine salvage crews operating off the coast of Florida.
In addition to his television work, Ward has produced educational and media projects through his firm, Ward Partners, a U.S.-based media and investment company.
Business and private lending career
Ward is the founder and CEO of Ward Partners, a private equity, fintech, and media company focused on real estate investment, lending, and education.
In 2025, Ward Partners acquired Think Realty, expanding its reach into real estate investment media, investor education, and technology.
Under Ward's leadership, Think Realty produces national conferences, education programs, and multimedia content serving real estate investors and private lenders across the United States.
Industry leadership and education
Ward serves on the Board of Education for the American Association of Private Lenders (AAPL) and has hosted the association's Fund Forum series for over three years.
He has authored seven articles for Private Lender Magazine, the official publication of AAPL, discussing investment strategy, fund management, and community engagement in the private lending space.
In 2024, Ward received the Community Impact and Outreach Award from AAPL, recognizing his contributions to education and community involvement in the private lending industry.
